summary: Step-by-step workflow templates for pre-production, editing, and publication optimized for retention-focused content.

core_principles.description: Script with visual cues sets foundation; editing executes planned structure
Group similar tasks (captions, graphics, audio) for workflow optimization
Use plugins, templates, and AI tools to enable weekly upload schedules
Review retention graphs after publication for continuous improvement
Final review checklist ensures technical quality and retention optimization

techniques.name: Pre-Production Scripting Workflow
techniques.description: AV format script with visual cues planned before shooting
implementation: Write script in AV table format (Audio | Visual
Include specific B-roll shot descriptions with angles and durations
Add motion design prompts for kinetic typography
Mark pacing notes for cuts and delivery
Plan visual change points every 3-5 seconds
Identify hook content and open loops
Create shot list and B-roll requirements
Review script for visual gaps before shooting
examples: AV script: 'Boots hit mud' | Low angle shot, rapid cut to drone summit
Script note: 'Text 50% animates in sync with word retention'
Pacing mark: '[CUT HERE] between sentence A and B'

pros_cons.pro: Prevents visual gaps, enables planned editing

techniques.name: Editing Phase Workflow
techniques.description: Step-by-step process from rough cut to polished retention edit
implementation: Step 1: Rough assembly in order of script
Step 2: Remove all fluff and dead air (zero-gap cuts)
Step 3: Apply pacing - vary cuts every 3-10 seconds
Step 4: Add B-roll and visual changes per script
Step 5: Insert kinetic typography and overlays
Step 6: Apply sound design and music stems
Step 7: Color grade for mood and contrast
Step 8: Final review for retention optimization
techniques.timing: Main editing phase, hours to days
examples: Timeline with markers every 5s for visual change check
Rough cut without effects, then add visual layer
Audio mixed before final color grade

techniques.name: Audio Batch Processing Workflow
techniques.description: Efficient audio processing with grouped tasks for speed
implementation: Batch process: compression, EQ, de-essing for all dialogue
Apply consistent loudness target (−16 LUFS
Create music stem library pre-processed
Build SFX library organized by type
Apply ducking rules consistently
Use automation for repetitive tasks
Process all dialogue first, then music, then SFX
Final master bus processing
examples: Same processing on all interview clips
SFX organized and labeled by category
tools: Preset libraries for dialogue, music, SFX

techniques.name: Motion Graphics Automation Workflow
techniques.description: Using templates and plugins to speed kinetic typography and graphics
implementation: Create MOGRT templates for recurring graphic types
Use Animation Composer for drag-and-drop animations
Build emoji/icon library with animations
Create lower third and overlay templates
Use AE expressions for automated effects
Batch process similar graphics
Save custom presets for frequently used effects
Maintain style guide for consistency
examples: Lower third template with editable text

techniques.name: Publication and Metadata Workflow
techniques.description: SEO-optimized publication process with all metadata prepared
implementation: Prepare title using optimization formulas
Write mini-blog description (200-300 words
Add timestamps starting at 00:00 (min 3 chapters
Link hierarchy: resources → recirculation → disclosures → socials
Upload custom captions (SRT) for SEO
Add 3-5 relevant hashtags
Set file permissions and visibility
Review for compliance (no deceptive practices)

pros_cons.con: Requires understanding of SEO best practices

techniques.name: Analytics Review and Iteration Workflow
implementation: Review retention graph 24-48 hours after publish
Identify major dip points - analyze cause
Note spike points - replicate value in future
Check CTR metrics in search and suggested feeds
Review watch time and session time metrics
Update script templates based on findings
Adjust pacing or hook structure for underperforming sections
A/B test titles and thumbnails for optimization
examples: Dip at 2:15 due to long pause - cut pause next time
CTR below target - test new thumbnail

pros_cons.pro: Optimizes for algorithm and audience preferences
pros_cons.con: May lead to optimization over creativity if unbalanced
